p: The substratum in South Cove is a mixture of bedrock and cobbles with patches of soft sediment. Conversely, Hangar Cove primarily has a base of compacted cobbles covered with a thin layer of fine sediment (2–3 cm) interspersed with patches of, deeper, fine sediment. In both coves the thickness of the soft sediment ranges from 0 to ~ 20 cm with a gently sloping topography. During summer icebergs impact the benthic communities in these coves and in the winter the sea surface is covered by fast ice for 3 to 8 months [ 15]. For this study, searches were conducted in the 15–21 m depth range for large patches of soft sediment. Six sites were selected within the two coves; South Cove (Fig. 5, sites A, B and C) and Hangar Cove (Fig. 5, sites D, E and F).
